companyDescription:
Agoda is transforming travel for millions of customers across the globe. 

Headquartered in Asia, Agoda is one of the world’s largest online travel platforms. Founded in 2005 and now part of Booking Holdings (Nasdaq:BKNG), Agoda has a network of over 2,900,000 properties worldwide. Our web and mobile products provide a first-rate reservation service in 38 languages that uniquely combines local knowledge and local connections to provide the best deals for business and leisure travelers.

Agoda employs over 7,000 professionals from 90 nationalities in locations around the globe. In every department – from engineering to customer experience – we provide an environment rich with creativity, collaboration, and experimentation, and the tools to work faster and smarter.

At Agoda, we believe our people are our strength. We work hard and have fun, and we choose people who are dedicated to making things great.

For properties seeking partnership with Agoda, visit https://connect.agoda.com

jobDescription:
Au CN, nous travaillons ensemble pour faire avancer notre entreprise et l’Amérique du Nord. Intégrez notre équipe Services informatiques et de la technologie (I et T), un élément essentiel du moteur qui nous maintient en mouvement. De l’architecture d’entreprise aux technologies opérationnelles, nos équipes font appel à la méthodologie Agile pour automatiser et numériser notre chemin de fer pour assurer l’optimisation et la sécurité de nos activités et permettre à notre personnel de se consacrer à des tâches à valeur ajoutée. Vous pourrez approfondir vos compétences et bâtir votre carrière dans notre culture tissée serrée et axée sur la sécurité, où nous travaillons ensemble comme UNE ÉQUIPE. Nous offrons des carrières valorisantes car notre travail fait une différence. Embarquez avec nous!

 Résumé des fonctions 

L’analyste Exploitation des données doit analyser et gérer avec succès les données générées par les technologies, les services et les systèmes du CN ou de l’extérieur.

En plus de contribuer à l’évolution globale de l’I et T du CN, cette personne veille à ce que les membres de l’équipe et les projets respectent toutes les exigences opérationnelles.

Les clients peuvent provenir de l’équipe I et T du CN ou des divers secteurs d’activité.

L’analyste Exploitation des données travaille en collaboration avec les équipes de scientifique des données, d’opérations d’apprentissage automatique et de processus de développement et d’exploitation (DevOps) pour concevoir et améliorer des solutions de données automatisées à temps plein entre les systèmes dans le nuage.

Cette personne élabore également des codes de vérification, et conçoit et optimise les outils de surveillance. Cette personne fait partie de l’équipe Exploitation des données et dirige des analyses après action pour le soutien à l’exploitation.

 Principales responsabilités 
 Concevoir et optimiser les pipelines de données pour faciliter l’extraction de données de sources multiples et les charger dans des entrepôts de données Utiliser l’automatisation pour simplifier le traitement des données Concevoir, mettre en place et maintenir des bases de données, des systèmes de collecte de données, des analyses de données et d’autres stratégies afin d’optimiser l’efficacité et la qualité statistiques Savoir repérer, analyser et interpréter des schémas, des tendances ou des modèles dans des données complexes Tester et adopter des solutions et des outils qui respectent les pratiques exemplaires d’Exploitation des données Améliorer les processus de développement et de déploiement des données Mettre en œuvre des normes de sécurité des données qui doivent être appliquées à l’ensemble des pipelines de données
Conditions de travail

 Ce poste prévoit des conditions de travail standard dans un bureau et un horaire de travail normal du lundi au vendredi. 

 Exigences minimales 
 Au moins 3 ans d’expérience de travail pertinente (avec une attention particulière en exploitation des données et en analyse des données)  Maîtrise ou baccalauréat en informatique, en génie informatique ou l’équivalent  Excellente connaissance de l’informatique infonuagique (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud, DataBricks)  Excellente connaissance des bases de données (MySQL, NoSQL, etc.)  Excellente connaissance du codage dans Python, Java  Expérience de travail avec des données structurées et non structurées  Connaissance de l’assurance de la qualité  Connaissance de REST API et de Node API  Connaissance des outils d’intégration continue et de livraison continue (Jenkins, Azure DevOps, Github, etc.)  Connaissance en gestion des registres, en surveillance d’applications et en surveillance d’infrastructures  Expérience de Kubernetes, Kafka et MQ  Expérience d’un outil d’orchestration des données (ADF, Databricks Workflows, etc.) 
 ATOUTS 
 Expérience d’Azure Data Explorer (ADX)  Solides compétences en communication  Capacité à sortir des sentiers battus  Certification DevOps  Expérience du secteur ferroviaire et de la commande intégrale des trains (CIT)  Expérience de l’Internet des objets  Expérience des projets d’apprentissage machine (MLOps)  Connaissance des réseaux, de la sécurité et des protocoles  Certification d’analyse des données (Azure, Databricks, GCP ou autre plateforme)  Certification d’expert en ingénierie des données (Azure DP-203, Databricks, GCP ou autre plateforme) 
 À propos du CN 

Le CN est un chef de file mondial du transport et un partenaire commercial majeur. Essentiel pour l'économie, les clients et les communautés dans lesquelles il exerce ses activités, le CN transporte annuellement de façon sécuritaire plus de 300 millions de tonnes de ressources naturelles, de produits manufacturés et de produits finis partout en Amérique du Nord. Seul chemin de fer reliant les côtes est et ouest du Canada à la pointe sud des États-Unis avec un réseau ferroviaire de 19 500 milles, le CN et ses filiales contribuent à la prospérité des collectivités et au commerce durable depuis 1919. Le CN demeure engagé à soutenir des programmes supportant la responsabilité sociale et les initiatives de protection de l’environnement. Au CN, nous travaillons comme UNE ÉQUIPE axée sur la sécurité et nos clients, offrant l’excellence sur le plan de l’exploitation et de la chaîne d’approvisionnement pour produire des résultats.

Le CN exige que tous les membres de son personnel soient entièrement vaccinés contre le COVID-19 et qu'ils en fournissent la preuve comme condition d'emploi. Le mandat de vaccination de la Compagnie s'étend aux membres du personnel de ses filiales en propriété exclusive ainsi qu'aux entrepreneurs, consultants, agents et fournisseurs du CN et à toute personne ayant accès aux propriétés du CN au Canada.

La forme grammaticale utilisée dans ce document vaut tant pour les hommes que pour les femmes. Le CN souscrit au principe de l’équité en emploi et invite toutes les personnes qualifiées à présenter leur candidature. Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt; cependant, nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les personnes dont la candidature sera retenue. Veuillez consulter régulièrement vos courriels, car les communications sont surtout envoyées par courrier électronique.
companyDescription:
CN is a North American transportation and logistics leader focused on supply chain innovation and collaboration. We offer integrated shipping solutions, including rail, intermodal, trucking, freight forwarding, warehousing and distribution. 

We are an engaged corporate citizen, committed to the safety of our employees, customers and the public. CN is invested in building shareholder value and stronger communities, focused on environmental stewardship and developing an exceptional environment in the workplace.
 
CN has the expertise, the network reach and the capacity to move your goods to a global marketplace in a safe, timely and cost effective manner. 

Welcome to CN, North America's Railroad.

jobTitle: Analyste associé principal de la gestion des données - contrat de 6 mois (hybride)/ Sr. Associate Data Management Analyst - 6 months contract (Hybrid)
jobDescription:
McKesson touche la vie des patients en œuvrant dans tous les secteurs de soins de santé dans le mais d'améliorer la santé en général. Chez McKesson Canada, nous créons un impact dans la vie de 12 millions de Canadiens, chaque jour. Nous distribuons plus de 35 000 produits à partir de 12 centres de distribution à 6 300 pharmacies de détail, 1 350 hôpitaux, centres de santé longue durée, cliniques et établissements de santé partout au Canada. Cependant, nous sommes beaucoup plus qu'une entreprise de distribution. Nous avons automatisé 2 500 pharmacies de détail et distribuons annuellement plus de 100 millions de doses de médicaments grâce à nos solutions d'automatisation. Les fabricants, les fournisseurs de soins de santé et les patients compétents sur nous pour une gamme complète de services qui contribuent à la qualité et l'
Chez McKesson, vous participez à la création de produits et de solutions qui contribuent à la réalisation de la mission de l'entreprise, soit améliorer la qualité de vie et faire progresser les soins de santé. Travailler ici représente une occasion d'édifier une industrie qui est vitale pour nous tous.
Résumé
Relevant du gestionnaire principal, Gestion des données, l'analyste associé principal de la gestion des données assure la qualité, la cohérence, l'exhaustivité et l'actualité des données de référence en veillant à ce que la création et la maintenance des données suivent les processus établis. Sa responsabilité consiste à traiter toutes les demandes et activités liées aux données de référence dans toutes les unités commerciales. Dans ce rôle, on s'attend à ce qu'il effectue des analyses des processus d'affaires, identifie les écarts et les inefficacités et propose des solutions pour aider à rationaliser les procédures. Ce rôle nécessite des interactions avec des parties prenantes internes et externes de diverses unités commerciales.
Section A – Responsabilités spécifiques
Gestion des données
Agit en tant que point de contact principal pour toutes les demandes de création ou de modification des données de base.Créez et confirmez les données de base dans les systèmes MDM.Gère les informations critiques telles que les détails du contrat, les spécifications des articles, les prix, les substitutions, les abandons et les paramètres d'intégrité des données.Créer, analyser et agir sur divers rapports de validation pour assurer le contrôle des données de base.Travailler directement avec les parties concernées internes et externes pour obtenir et valider les informations pertinentes des données de base et communiquer les normes et processus requis, en assurant la qualité et l'intégrité des données.Communiquer aux commerciaux concernés toute information pertinente reçue des partenaires internes ou externes.Assurer la qualité des informations du système, le référentiel de décisions et l'exactitude de son contenu.Signaler aux fournisseurs toute l'efficacité liée aux informations sur les articles et les prix.Résoudre les problèmes techniques en établissant un diagnostic ou, le cas échéant, en collaborant avec l'équipe de soutien informatique concernée pour parvenir à une résolution.
Section B - Responsabilités générales
Autres
Maintient une connaissance commerciale pertinente des processus de données de référence, des systèmes de MDM et des exigences commerciales.Résoudre les problèmes techniques en établissant un diagnostic ou, le cas échéant, en collaborant avec l'équipe d'assistance informatique concernée pour parvenir à une solution.Participe aux initiatives et aux projets de gestion des données de référence.Agit en tant qu'ambassadeur McKesson des valeurs de l'entreprise.
Section C - Exigences du poste
Éducation
Baccalauréat en commerce ou en administration, gestion des données ou équivalence d'expérience en affaires.
Développement personnel et compétences générales
Bilinguisme (anglais et français) à l'écrit et à l'oral.Leadership démontré.Excellentes compétences en matière de partenariat.Excellentes compétences en communication orale et écrite.Capacité à interagir avec divers niveaux de gestion et d'employés.
Compétences techniques
Expérience dans les domaines de la gestion des données, de l'analyse et de la création de requêtes, un atout important.Parfaitement bilingue, tant à l'écrit qu'à l'oral.Maîtrise des systèmes ERP et des systèmes de réapprovisionnement, un atout.Connaissance approfondie des produits MS Office (Power Point, Excel, Word, Project et Visio).Connaissance de SAP (un atout)
Autres compétences et aptitudes
Capacité à travailler dans un environnement dynamique en évolution rapide.Capacité à travailler au sein d'équipes multifonctionnelles.Souci du détail, tout en conservant un sens aigu de la synthèse et une capacité à synthétiser.Capacités d'analyse permettant la création d'un état d'esprit favorisant l'innovation.Esprit d'équipe.Capacité à travailler efficacement avec peu de supervision
Le.la titulaire de ce poste aura à soutenir de façon quotidienne des clients internes et/ou externes à l'extérieur du Québec et/ou aux États-Unis. Par conséquent, ce poste requiert une maîtrise de l'anglais à l'écrit et à l'oral. Veuillez noter que le nombre de postes dont les tâches nécessitent une connaissance de la langue anglaise a été restreint dans la mesure du possible.
_________________________________________________________________________________________________
McKesson is in the business of better health, and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. At McKesson Canada, we touch the lives of 12 million Canadians every day. We carry more than 35,000 products in 12 distribution centers and ultimately provide distribution to 6,300 retail pharmacies, 1,350 hospitals, long-term care centers, clinics and institutions all over Canada. But we're so much more than a distribution company. We've automated 2,500 retail pharmacies and dispense over 100 million doses a year through our automation solutions. Manufacturers, healthcare providers and patients count on us for a full range of services that contribute to the quality and safety of care for us all.
At McKesson Canada, you’ll help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that’s vital to us all.
Job Summary
Reporting to the Senior Manager, Data Management, the Sr. Associate Data Management Analyst assures the quality, consistency, completeness and timeliness of the Master Data information by ensuring the creation and maintenance of the data follows established processes. Their responsibility is to process all Master Data requests and activities across all business units. Performing business process analyses, identifying gaps and inefficiencies, and proposing solutions to help streamline the procedures is expected in this role. This role requires interactions with internal and external stakeholders from various business units.
Section A – Specific Responsibilities
Master Data Management
Acts as the main point of contact for all requests for creation or modification of Master Data.Creates and maintains Master Data in MDM systems.Manages critical information such as contract details, item specifications, pricing, substitutions, discontinuations and data integrity parameters.Creates, analyzes and acts upon various validation reports to ensure control of the Master Data.Works directly with internal and external stakeholders to obtain and validate relevant Master Data information and communicates the required standards and processes, assuring data quality and integrity.Communicates to applicable business partners any relevant information received from internal or external stakeholders.Ensures system information quality, decisions repository and its content accuracy.Reports supplier non-compliance on any inefficiencies related to item and pricing information.Solve technical problems by establishing a diagnosis or, where applicable, working with applicable IT Support Team to reach a resolution.
Other
Section B – General Responsibilities
Maintains relevant business knowledge of Master Data processes, MDM systems and business requirements.Solves technical problems by establishing a diagnosis or, where applicable, working with applicable IT Support Team to reach a resolution.Actively participates in master data management initiatives and projects.Acts as a McKesson ambassador of corporate values.
Section C – Position Requirements
Education
Bachelor of Commerce or Administration, Data Management or business experience equivalence.
Personal Development and Soft Skills
Bilingualism (English and French) in writing and speakingDemonstrated leadership.Excellent partnering skills.Excellent oral and written communication skillsAbility to collaborate with various levels of management and employees.
Technical Skills
Experience in the fields of data management, analysis and query creation a strong assetPerfectly bilingual, both written and spoken.Proficiency with ERP systems and replenishment systems an asset.Extensive knowledge of MS Office products (Power Point, Excel, Word, Project and Visio).Knowledge of SAP (an asset)
Other Skills And Capabilities
Ability to work in a rapidly changing dynamic environmentAbility to work as part of multi-functional teams.Attention to detail, whilst maintaining a strong sense of summary and ability to synthesize.Analytical capacities allowing the creation of a state of mind favoring innovationTeam player.Ability to work effectively with little supervision
The incumbent of this position will provide daily support to internal and/or external clients outside Quebec and/or in the United States. Therefore, he/she must be proficient in spoken and written English. Please note that the number of positions requiring English language skills has been limited where possible.
Niveau de carrière – IC – Professionnel – P2
At McKesson, we care about the well-being of the patients and communities we serve, and that starts with caring for our people. That’s why we have a Total Rewards package that includes comprehensive benefits to support physical, mental, and financial well-being. Our Total Rewards offerings serve the different needs of our diverse employee population and ensure they are the healthiest versions of themselves. companyDescription:
At McKesson Canada, our vision is to improve care in every setting — one product, one partner, one patient at a time. 
We partner with hospitals, physicians, pharmacies, nurses, biopharmaceutical manufacturers and others across the spectrum of care to build healthier communities. By helping our partners be as successful as possible, we work together to improve patients’ lives.

jobDescription:
We are hiring freelance English & French speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.
This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.
RequirementsFull Professional Proficiency in English & FrenchYou must be living in Canada for the last 2 consecutive yearsAbility to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website informationYou must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in CanadaBeing open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)Applicants must be 18 years or over.
Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

jobDescription:
Overview Paladin Security: Making the World a Safer and Friendlier Place! Do you have superior customer service skills and a passion for helping people? Are you able to think quickly on your feet and defuse difficult situations? Your track record of handling a great deal of responsibility combined with your varied life experience and enthusiasm for a job well done make you an ideal candidate for our team! The Paladin Difference starts with our officers; we're the best because we hire the best. We believe in promoting from within, respecting people and their differences, providing high quality service and always having fun! If you think you have what it takes to join our team, we want to meet you! Job Skills / Requirements
The Data Analyst is primarily responsible for creating and maintaining effective reports in Power BI, Excel, and other reporting tools, as deemed necessary. This person will bring a sharp analytical mind, inclination for problem solving, and strong communication skills to provide meaningful
insights that can translate into evidence-based business decisions. This position is hybrid-remote and open to any person that can work out of any one of our branch offices (Canada & US).
Key Responsibilities
Prepares reports in Power BI, Excel, and WordConducts research and meets with internal stakeholders to thoroughly understand business problems and reporting deliverablesCreates presentations showcasing reporting insights and actionable strategiesAssists with the development of data warehouse objects in SQL / Microsoft AzureThinks critically to offer effective solutions / improvements to data collection and report generation processesMonitors the performance of reports and implements improvements as requiredPerforms other duties as required to meet organizational requirementsSkills & Requirements 
Proficiency with SQL, Power BI (DAX and Power Query), and ExcelExperience with data warehousing and creating/using relational data modelsHighly analytical mindset and an ability to prepare reports including descriptive statisticsAbility to communicate technical requirements and reporting insights effectivelyExcellent prioritization and time management skills; exceptional attention to detailSelf-motivated with limited direction Additional Information / Benefits We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those applicants that are short listed will be contacted for an interview.

companyName: Caisse de dépôt et placement du Québec (CDPQ)
jobTitle: Analyste, Opérations – Données et transactions- FR
jobDescription:
La CDPQ c’est vous !

/ Réalisez des projets porteurs de rendements et de retombées économiques, au bénéfice des Québécoises et des Québécois

/ Collaborez avec des professionnels de haut niveau, au sein d’équipes dynamiques et mobilisées autour d'objectifs communs

/ Relevez des défis stimulants, à la mesure de vos capacités et de votre talent

/ Évoluez au quotidien dans un milieu de travail inspirant, à la fine pointe de la technologie et des meilleures pratiques environnementales

Description d'emploi

Relevant de la directrice principale, Opérationnalisation des investissements, le titulaire sera impliqué dans diverses tâches opérationnelles : configuration des instruments financiers et données de référence et saisie de transactions. Le titulaire participera activement à la réalisation des activités du plan d’affaires de la Caisse. Il contribuera également à l’amélioration continue des processus en place.

Principales responsabilités 
Gérer au quotidien les demandes transactionnelles reçues par l’ensemble des secteurs d’affaires de la Caisse; Effectuer la saisie ou l’import de diverses transactions dans l’auxiliaire;Effectuer le suivi et la saisie des opérations de marché sur diverses transactions;Configurer les données de référence ainsi que les instruments financiers (actions, obligations, produits dérivés, émetteurs, contreparties, etc.); Suivre quotidiennement les exceptions générées par le progiciel de données et s’assurer de leurs résolutions;Exécuter les contrôles quotidiens reliés aux activités de l’équipe et s’assurer de la résolution de tout écart/exception relevé par ces contrôles;Maintenir à jour les différentes procédures opérationnelles.
Exigences 
Diplôme de premier cycle en finance ou toute autre discipline connexe;Expérience pertinente, nous considérerons aussi les finissants voulant se développerBonne connaissance des concepts reliés aux instruments financiers; Excellente maîtrise d’Excel et de SQL; Très bonne connaissance des logiciels de la suite Microsoft Office (Word, Outlook, etc.);Bonne connaissance des différents fournisseurs de données de marché (Bloomberg, Reuters, Markit, etc.); Bonne maîtrise des logiciels Murex et Markit-EDM, un atout; Excellente maîtrise du français et de l’anglais, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit;Bonne connaissance de base de tous les types de produits financiers.
Compétences 
Rigueur;Planification et gestion des priorités;Habileté à gérer le stress;Autonomie et initiative;Aptitude à proposer des solutions et les implanter selon les échéanciers.
Nous contacterons uniquement les personnes retenues pour une entrevue.

La CDPQ offre des chances d'emploi égales à tous. Elle invite les femmes, les membres des minorités visibles et ethniques, les autochtones et les personnes handicapées à présenter leur candidature. La CDPQ s'engage également à poursuivre l'intégration de la diversité et à en faire une source d'enrichissement et de fierté pour tous ses employés. Veuillez nous informer si votre condition actuelle nécessite des mesures d'adaptation au niveau du processus de recrutement.

Des études démontrent que les femmes et les membres de groupes traditionnellement sous-représentés ont tendance à appliquer sur un poste uniquement lorsqu’ils répondent à toutes les exigences.

Si vous êtes motivé.e par cette offre d’emploi, mais que vous ne correspondez pas à tous les critères, contactez-nous quand même !

La CDPQ représente la Caisse de dépôt et placement du Québec et ses filiales.
companyDescription:
At CDPQ, we invest constructively to generate sustainable returns over the long term. As a global investment group managing funds for public retirement and insurance plans, we work alongside our partners to build enterprises that drive performance and progress. We are active in the major financial markets, private equity, infrastructure, real estate and private debt. As at As at June 30, 2022, CDPQ’s net assets totalled CAD 391.6 billion. 

CDPQ is a registered trademark owned by Caisse de dépôt et placement du Québec and licensed for use by its subsidiaries.

jobDescription:
Definity includes some of Canada’s most long-standing and innovative insurance brands, including Economical Insurance, Sonnet Insurance, Family Insurance Solutions, and Petline Insurance. With strong roots that date back to 1871, we’ve grown to become a digital leader in the insurance industry. We’re proud to help our clients and communities adapt and thrive in a world of constant change.
Our promise to you: It’s better here. Why? Because we CARE, and we provide an employee experience that’s collaborative, ambitious, rewarding, and empowering.
Our ambition is to be one of Canada’s leading and most innovative P&C insurers. Come be a part of our journey, and love what you do.
Definity offers a flexible, hybrid work experience where employees work from the office and virtually depending on the type of work they are doing and who they are working with. Leader’s partner with their teams to find the right balance of on-site and remote work that best meets the needs of their teams, colleagues, brokers and customers, while ensuring collaboration, teamwork and accountability for goals.
What can you expect in this role?
Ensure comprehensive test coverage by creating well-structured test plans and test casesDesign and develop manual & automation scriptsResponsible for finding, isolating, documenting, tracking, and regressing defects through the QE process utilizing a bug tracking tool effectivelyWork with testing data: seeding, masking, synthetic data generationWork with Big data platform to validate data ingestion, ETL, data integrity, data analytical reports etc.Analyze ongoing requirements to ensure quality delivery, aligned with business goals and enterprise and Technology Solutions (TS) standards.Work collaboratively with stakeholders across business and technology teams seeking opportunities to improve the quality of delivery and demonstrate commitment to operational excellence for all deliverables.Estimate testing effort working with other team members and set priorities following a risk-based testing approachCreate and run queries using Hue to meet business needsCreate and review test cases; Report test results and highlight any potential quality risksTo accelerate product delivery through test automation.Assess risk with projects delivery quality, identify and execute risk mitigation plans
What do you bring to the role?
Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or a related discipline.5+ years experience in Quality engineeringProven experience within the Insurance Industry2+ years experience in the technical area of specialty, specifically SQL and Big Data Stack (Hue, Hive, Impala, HBase), BigQuery, Cloud, Python/Pyspark or similar data platformStrong ability to analyze the business and user requirements and translate them into testing deliverables such as testing data, SQL query and expected resultsStrong ability to develop test plans and run analysis on testing resultsExperience in data ingestion, ETL testing, data integrity testing and Data lake/Cloud testingExperience in any DH Automation tools or technologies (Python/Pyspark)Experience in Agile software development practice and methodologiesGoal-oriented; must be able to remove roadblocks and deliver goalsStrong communication and interpersonal skillsProven ability to quickly and easily adapt to change
We also take potential into consideration. If you don’t have this exact experience, but you know you have what it takes, be sure to give us more insight through your application and cover letter.
Go ahead and expect a lot — you deserve it, and we’ve got it: 
Hybrid work schedule for most rolesCompany share ownership programPension and savings programs, with company-matched RRSP contributionsPaid volunteer days and company matching on charitable donationsEducational resources, tuition assistance, and paid time off to study for examsFocus on inclusion with employee groups, support for gender affirmation surgery, access to BIPOC counsellors, access to programs for working parentsWellness and recognition programsDiscounts on products and services
Our inclusive work environment welcomes diversity and supports accessibility. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please let us know by contacting: [email protected]
Background checks
This role requires successful clearance of a background check (including criminal checks and leadership references).
companyDescription:
Definity invests in multi-channel operations to provide our fellow Canadians with optimal insurance coverage options for their homes, vehicles, farms, pets, and businesses.

We’re proudly Canadian, and we offer a range of responsive, service-backed insurance solutions for customers from coast to coast. Definity has deep roots, dating all the way back to November 25, 1871, when our founding brand, the Economical Mutual Fire Insurance Company, issued its first policy to protect Ismael D. Bowman’s barn and home. Today, Definity continues the tradition of providing Canadians with great service, whether that’s through a licensed broker or through our digital direct channels.

Get to know our family of companies:
Economical Insurance
Sonnet Insurance
Family Insurance Solutions
Petline Insurance
-
Definity investit dans des activités multicanaux afin d’offrir à nos concitoyens canadiens des options de couverture optimales pour leurs domiciles, véhicules, fermes, animaux de compagnie et entreprises.

Nous sommes fiers d’être Canadiens et nous offrons une gamme de solutions d’assurance adaptées ainsi qu’un service à nos clients d’un bout à l’autre du pays. Definity a des racines profondes, qui remontent au 25 novembre 1871, lorsque notre marque fondatrice, l’Economical Mutual Fire Insurance Company, a émis sa première police pour protéger l’étable et la maison d’Ismael D. Bowman. Aujourd’hui, Definity poursuit sa tradition d’offrir aux Canadiens un excellent service, tant par l’entremise d’un courtier d’assurance autorisé que par notre réseau numérique direct.

Découvrez notre famille de compagnies :
Assurance Economical
Sonnet Assurance
Family Insurance Solutions
Petline

jobDescription:
Req ID: 110850

Region: Americas

Country: Canada

State/Province: Ontario

City: Mississauga

16 Month Internship

Celestica (NYSE, TSX: CLS) is a US$5.8 billion global leader in design, manufacturing, hardware platform and supply chain solutions. We bring global expertise and insight at every stage of product development - from the drawing board to full-scale production and after-market services. Through our unrivalled customer-centric approach, we partner with leading companies in aerospace and defense, communications, enterprise, healthtech, industrial, capital equipment, and smart energy to deliver solutions for their most complex challenges.

Celestica is a high-integrity work environment and when you join Celestica you are a part of a leading global company that enables the world’s best brands, and contributes to our innovative and collaborative solutions that help our customers unlock the potential of the future.

Our global network spans 13 countries with 24,500 employees across the Americas, Europe and Asia. At our Toronto headquarters, we are focused on attracting top talent into our organization, including interns from universities and colleges.

Celestica's internship program provides students with valuable development through real-life work experience, exciting projects and networking with industry professionals.

Benefits For Students Include
Experience working for one of the largest Canadian global technology companiesPossibility of a student casual contract position after completion of internship Possibility of a full-time position after completion of degree Access to Celestica’s development programs and projectsCelestica's Time Off to Volunteer program – two paid days off to volunteer per yearFun intern activities including celebration events and networkingInternal recognition programs and rewards for stellar performance
What’s in it for you?
Opportunity: Job experience at a large Canadian-based global companyInnovation: We look to our employees to implement new ideas and improve the way we do thingsCollaboration: Students work as part of global teams, enabled by collaborative technologySustainability: We uphold strong ethics, reduce our impact on the environment and empower employees to give back to the community with two paid days off per year to volunteerDevelopment opportunities: including soft skills courses, innovation projects and mentorshipNetworking: Strategically build your professional network to advance your career and deepen relationships across your peers and colleaguesFun: Our interns have the opportunity to participate in fun activities including intern social events, Celestica’s charitable initiatives and our Spirit Week activities 
About This Opportunity

The Inventory & Data Analytics Intern will work on analytics, dashboards and visual cadence on business governance. They will support analytics, automation and visibility of the business to support Inventory, Supplier Governance and SIOP (Sales, Inventory, and Operations Planning) activities.

Preferred Skills
Strong knowledge in Microsoft (Advanced Excel skills) and Google SuitesAbility to analyze complex dataFinance background will be an assetA positive and energetic attitude with a drive to accomplish set tasksAbility to work independently and as a part of a teamAbility to be innovative and out of the box thinker
Activities
Perform data analysis on sales, inventory, operations performance and planning functionsSupport interpretation of data into information by working with a cross functional teamCreate presentations for sideways and leadership communication on business performancesDevelop and sustain KPIs to measure performance and success alongside a healthy governance cadenceAnalyze root cause in data anomalies and work with peers and leaders to correct dataSupport direct manager in overall strategic governance management, customer communications, visits and administration
Physical Demands, duties of this position are varied and will include:
Work performed in a normal office environmentMay require extended periods of sitting and sustained visual concentration on a computer monitor or on numbers and other detailed dataRepetitive manual movements are frequently required (eg. Data entry, using a computer mouse, etc…)Ability to lift up to 30lbs
Area: Operations/Supply Chain Management

Start Date: May 2023

Location: 3333 Unity Drive, Mississauga Ontario L5L 3S6

Experience: No formal experience is required

Education: Currently enrolled in a University Internship program completing 3rd year of an Finance, Business, Analytics, Supply Chain / Operations program.
As this position involves work that is subject to the Canadian Government's Controlled Goods Program (CGP), your employment offer is conditional upon the successful completion of a security assessment by Celestica and/or its authorized agents, per the Controlled Goods Regulations.
To apply, please visit www.celestica.com. Please provide a copy of your transcript with your application. Please include your student email address in your application.

Celestica is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on any protected status (including race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran or disability status or other characteristics protected by law).

At Celestica we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates throughout the hiring process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.
companyDescription: Celestica enables the world's best brands. Through our unrivalled customer-centric approach, we partner with leading companies in aerospace and defense, communications, enterprise, healthtech, industrial, capital equipment, and smart energy to deliver solutions for their most complex challenges. A leader in design, manufacturing, hardware platform and supply chain solutions, Celestica brings global expertise and insight at every stage of product development - from the drawing board to full-scale production and after-market services. With talented teams across North America, Europe and Asia, we imagine, develop and deliver a better future with our customers..

jobDescription:
Product Analyst Gaming Canada - Remote
A hyper-growth startup within the Gaming domain is in the market for a technically savvy Product Analytics professional to join their team. If you are hands-on and can ultimately communicate trend analysis to both technical and non-technical audiences, then this can be the move for you!
THE ROLE– Product Analyst In this capacity, you will be responsible for facilitating product data initiatives for an organization that is analytically driven from the top down. You will utilize best-of-breed statistical and visualization tools to inform key decisions across the business; the ideal candidate will have ample experience leveraging the aforementioned tools to ultimately generate product insights that will ultimately benefit the greater business as a whole.
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field. Master's preferred.Experience within a gaming or tech. domain strongly preferred.Previous experience in a Product Analytics capacity is needed.Strong proficiency with SQL is required. Exposure to open-source statistical languages such as Python or R is strongly preferred.Deep understanding of using raw data to draw insights.Great communication skills and the ability to work with stakeholders cross-functionally.Ample experience utilizing BI tools for story-telling purposes, including Tableau, PowerBI, Domo, Looker, etc.

HOW TO APPLY?:Please register your interest by sending your Resume to Greffen George via the Apply link on this page
KEYWORDS:SQL, Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, Stakeholder Management, Story-Telling, User Requirements, Gaming, Games, Product, Python, R, Product Analytics, Stakeholder Management, Product Features
companyDescription:
Established in 2006, Harnham were founded as a specialist recruitment business for the Data & Analytics market. Over the past 15 years, we’ve grown into the global leader in Data & Analytics recruitment with over 200 consultants, covering permanent and contract vacancies across the UK, Europe, and USA, and winning several awards along the way. 

Our unique networking style has meant that we’ve established a client and candidate base built on trust, focus, and efficiency. As a result of this, our clients have given us a Net Promoter Score (NPS) of 83, whilst our candidates have given us 88, both far above industry averages.

Specialising in roles throughout Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Digital Analytics, Life Science Analytics, Data & Technology, Data Engineering, Risk Analytics and Computer Vision we support candidates and businesses working in what we believe to be the world's most innovative and exciting industry. 

Above and beyond our recruiting services, our annual Salary and Diversity Guides are seen as the go-to resources in our field and are used to benchmark and drive progress by many industry leaders. Additionally, we are closely partnered with two organisations looking to help improve Diversity in the world of Data & Analytics: In2ScienceUK (in2scienceuk.org) and Women in Data (womenindata.org).

jobDescription:
Description
Secteur tarification / Analyste de données / Télétravail / Québec / Montréal / Emploi étudiant / Entrée en poste dès que possible
Tu souhaites joindre une équipe dynamique et développer ton plein potentiel dans un environnement de travail humain et stimulant? Ne cherche plus, nous avons le poste pour toi !
Nous sommes à la recherche d'un(e) étudiant(e) - Analyste de données au sein du secteur de la tarification, des nouvelles affaires et des réclamations en assurance individuelle. Voilà l’opportunité de faire partie d’une équipe multidisciplinaire qui te permettra de développer tes connaissances de l’assurance vie en travaillant en étroite collaboration avec différents corps de métier spécialisés.
En contribuant à l’équipe, tu auras l’opportunité de : 
Prendre en charge des demandes ad-hoc ou récurrentes d’extractions de données ou de statistiques;Contacter les demandeurs afin de clarifier les demandes et/ou expliquer les données fournies;Améliorer ou développer des tableaux de bord afin de répondre aux besoins de gestionnaires et de partenaires;Automatiser certains traitements manuels de données;Procéder à l’examen et à l’analyse de données provenant de multiples sources internes et externes;Contribuer à des analyses visant à améliorer l’efficacité des opérations et à expliquer certains résultats ou écarts;Contribuer occasionnellement à tester de nouvelles règles de tarification en faisant de la saisie d’informations et en validant les résultats obtenus.
Tu es la personne que l’on recherche si :
Tu étudies au baccalauréat en intelligence d’affaires, statistiques, mathématiques, actuariat, informatique, administration ou autre discipline connexe, en cours;Tu as une bonne connaissance de la suite Office;Tu as des connaissances en Power BI ou équivalent;Tu connais le langage SQL;Tu fais preuve de proactivité et d’innovation dans la recherche de solutions;Tu es en mesure de travailler sur plusieurs tâches et projets en même temps, tout en respectant les échéanciers;Tu as la capacité à comprendre, analyser, synthétiser, émettre des diagnostics et faire des recommandations;Tu as de la facilité à communiquer et vulgariser des concepts complexes;Tu es disponible 14h partsemaine, de jour du lundi au vendredi.
Cette offre t’interpelle et tu aimerais faire partie d’une équipe dynamique? N’attends plus et applique dès maintenant!

jobDescription:
Continuous Improvement Data Analyst

The Continuous Improvement analyst is highly capable of interpreting and analyzing results using statistical techniques, can develop and implement data analysis, and data collection systems; combined with other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality. With knowledge on how to acquire data from primary and secondary data sources, implementing, and maintaining databases. With strong time management and planning skills, able to work with different business units simultaneously supplying its needs keeping a Continuous Improvement culture.

Responsibilities
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality within operations and other stakeholders.Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.Filter and "clean" data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.Work with management to prioritize business and information needs.Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.Monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.
Qualifications
Proven working experience as a Business Data Analyst 1-2 years (preferably - BPO/Call Center).Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques.Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (PowerBi, Excel).Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.Preferably working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques (or equivalent) and a desire to further develop one's skillset.University Degree in Computer Science or related.

jobDescription:
Data Analyst
Surrey (King George Hub), BC, 13630 George Jct #115, Surrey, British Columbia, Canada Req #1313
Tuesday, September 20, 2022
Westland Insurance Group Ltd. has an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst located in our brand new hybrid head office in Surrey, BC. As an early hire on a new team, your impact will be significant. You will collaborate with leaders across the organization to influence and execute on an ambitious analytics roadmap that extends across insurance operations, marketing, finance, and other departments.
If you are interested in applying for the role, please submit your application by October 7, 2022.
What We Offer
 Competitive salary  Comprehensive medical and dental benefits  Permanent hybrid work environment  Diverse mix of staff and demonstrated work/life balance  Career growth opportunities and continuing education programs 
The Opportunity
As a Data Analyst at Westland Insurance Group,you will be responsible for evolving the way data is leveraged to inform decision making. This is a great opportunity to help lay the foundation and infrastructure for data analytics inside of a unique organization which is both an insurer and broker. You will strive to understand the data, build out processes for improving the quality of the data and put in place automated core reporting. You will work with stakeholders to identify and prioritize use cases for analysis and begin to build out models to answer business questions.
In This Role You'll
 Performing analysis on key business opportunities and risks across a variety of functions  Designing and implementing automated reporting and monitoring  Working with IT and other stakeholders to improve the quality of the Westland data asset  Working with different functions to understand their analysis needs  Presenting findings to diverse audiences  Working to increase the use of data in decision making across Westland Insurance  Preparing data and exhibits for partners as required 
Here's What You Bring
 Bachelor's degree in a related field: mathematics, statistics, actuarial science or computer science  A minimum of 2 years' experience in a data analytics role  Strong background in math, statistics or equivalent  Previous experience with data analysis and modeling using SQL, R, and Python  Excellent verbal and written communication skills  Strong ability to interpret and present business data findings to a variety of audiences  High degree of accuracy and keen attention to detail  Experience in P&C insurance an asset but not a prerequisite 
You belong here
We strive to be much more than a great place to work. Here, you join a collective of incredibly vibrant, purpose driven, and open-minded people. Every day, Westland proves that building a great business means taking care of communities, clients, and each other with equal commitment. You will be supported and respected for who you are and for the voice you add to the conversation.
At Westland, you will feel the power of community. Westland Insurance Ltd. is an inclusive organization that values diversity in its workforce. We listen, champion equity and diversity, and create safe welcoming spaces where everyone has a voice and is free to be themselves. Westland Insurance Ltd. encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants' disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.
If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the recruitment team by email at careers@westlandinsurance.ca
Apply Now

jobDescription:
TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects.
We offer  flexible work-from-home  opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are  part-time  , and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com
We are hiring freelance English speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.
This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.
Requirements
 Full Professional Proficiency in English  You must be living in Canada the last consecutive years  Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information  You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Canada  Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)  Applicants must be 18 years or over. 
Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.
Why Join the TELUS International AI Community? 
 Earn extra income  Access to our community wellbeing initiative  Remote work & Location Independence  Be your own boss  Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle  Be a part of an online community 
Additional Job Description
 We are hiring freelance English speaking Online Data Analyst’s for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.
companyDescription: TELUS International designs, builds and delivers next-generation digital solutions to enhance the customer experience (CX) for global and disruptive brands. The company’s services support the full lifecycle of its clients’ digital transformation journeys and enable them to more quickly embrace next-generation digital technologies to deliver better business outcomes. TELUS International’s integrated solutions and capabilities span digital strategy, innovation, consulting and design, digital transformation and IT lifecycle solutions, data annotation and intelligent automation, and omnichannel CX solutions that include content moderation, trust and safety solutions, and other managed solutions. Fueling all stages of company growth, TELUS International partners with brands across high growth industry verticals, including tech and games, communications and media, eCommerce and fintech, healthcare, and travel and hospitality.

jobTitle: Data Leakage Analyste de prévention - Gradue (e)
jobDescription:
Dans un monde qui change, des défis sans précédent exigent des talents inégalés. Rejoignez l’un des Meilleurs Employeurs de Montréal 2022. Nous sommes une organisation dynamique et en pleine croissance dont l’établissement principal est situé au centre-ville de Montréal et faisant partie d’un groupe financier international pleinement engagé dans la construction d’un futur durable. À noter que le poste peut être au sein de la Succursale canadienne de BNP Paribas ou de l’une de ses filiales basées à Montréal.
Programme d'études supérieures
En tant que diplômé, vous bénéficierez d'un programme de 18 mois qui vise à vous donner les outils pour vous développer et découvrir votre potentiel à travers des formations personnalisées, des sessions de réseautage et des projets transversaux.
De plus amples informations sur le programme sont disponibles sur notre site :
BNP Paribas au Canada Étudiants & Jeunes diplômés
Le poste en un coup d’œil
L'analyste Data Leakage Prevention fait partie d'une équipe Opérations, Surveillance et Investigation chargée de la sécurité des données de BNP Paribas.
Cet analyste traitera quotidiennement les alertes liées à d’éventuelles fuites de données ou à des incidents de manipulation ou de quasi-omission dans plusieurs plates-formes de surveillance, intensifiera les événements pour les enquêtes, traitera les incidents et soutiendra les rapports, la documentation et les efforts d’automatisation de l’équipe.
Dans le détail
 Surveillez les alertes de prévention des pertes de données en temps réel Détecter et traiter les violations/incidents de fuite de données et effectuer des analyses de données supplémentaires pour valider les atteintes à la sécurité Relâcher les courriels sortants légitimes mis en quarantaine par les politiques du DLP Créer des rapports et des mesures
Les atouts et compétences qui vous feront réussir
 Connaissance des concepts de sécurité des données et de prévention des fuites de données, menaces internes, règles et exécution des processus Créer, filtrer, résumer, personnaliser et distribuer des rapports Connaissance des incidents et enquêtes, remédiation, suivi et suivi de la clôture des billets avec les équipes techniques concernées et les intervenants d'affaires concernés La connaissance de Symantec ou de McAfee Data Loss Prevention (DLP) est un plus Compréhension des dispositifs de sécurité des réseaux et des terminaux : Firewall, Data Labeling solutions, Endpoint Protection, Data-at-rest et Data- in-Transit protection, Symmetric et asymetric Encryption etc.
Ce que l’on vous offre
En plus d’une rémunération compétitive, nous vous offrons de nombreux avantages y compris un programme d’assurance famille et conjoint flexible, un régime de retraite à cotisations définies et des jours payés pour le bénévolat. Des arrangements de travail hybrides, tel que le télétravail jusqu'à 50% et des horaires flexibles sont disponibles pour la plupart des postes. BNP Paribas offre d'excellents programmes de formation et de développement personnel, ainsi que des opportunités d’évolution au sein de l'entreprise et à l’international.
Pour en savoir plus sur notre gamme d’avantages, cliquez ici
Ce que vous devez savoir
Nous examinerons les candidat.e.s au fur et à mesure qu'ils postulent, alors ne tardez pas à soumettre votre candidature ;Si vous êtes sélectionné.e pour participer au processus de recrutement, informez les ressources humaines de tout accommodement dont vous pourriez avoir besoin. BNP Paribas travaillera avec vous pour s'assurer que vous êtes en mesure de participer pleinement au processus ;Vous devez être légalement admissible à travailler dans la grande région de Montréal et, s’il y a lieu, détenir un permis de travail ou d’études valide. La présence physique dans le(s) bureau(x) de BNP Paribas est un prérequis essentiel pour ce poste ;Notant que la grande majorité de notre clientèle, tant interne qu’externe, est située à l’extérieur du Québec et du Canada, nos postes requièrent des employé.e.s qu’ils parlent une autre langue que le français, soit l’anglais pour la plupart des postes. D’autres langues peuvent être également être requises pour d’autres postes, tels que l’espagnol ou le portugais, et ces exigences sont alors clairement indiquées dans les requis du poste ;Tous les employés de BNP Paribas Canada doivent être adéquatement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 à la date de leur embauche, à moins d’en être exemptés pour une raison protégée par la Loi canadienne sur les droits de la personne.
La diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion (DE&I) au cœur de nos engagements :
Valoriser chaque employé.e de l’organisation en tant qu’individu et traiter tout le monde sur un même pied d’égalité, nous permet de créer un environnement de travail qui valorise et respecte les personnes pour leurs talents, leurs aptitudes et leurs compétences.
BNP Paribas recrute, emploie, forme, paye et promeut indépendamment de la race, de la religion, de la couleur, de l'origine, du genre, de l’orientation sexuelle, du handicap, de l'âge et autres statuts protégés (Loi sur l’équité et matière d’emploi et la Loi canadienne sur les droits de la personne).
Pour en savoir plus sur nos engagement en terme de DE&I, cliquez-ici
À propos de nous
BNP Paribas est la première banque de l’Union européenne et un acteur bancaire international de premier plan. Présent dans 65 pays, avec plus de 190 000 collaborateurs, le Groupe détient des positions clés dans plusieurs domaines d’activité bancaires et de services financiers.
La mission de BNP Paribas est de contribuer à une économie responsable et durable en finançant et en conseillant ses clients selon les normes éthiques les plus élevées, tout en nous efforçant de répondre aux préoccupations essentielles en matière d’environnement, de développement des territoires et d’inclusion sociale.
Depuis 1961, BNP Paribas au Canada accompagne les grandes entreprises et institutions canadiennes dans leur développement d’affaires, en offrant une gamme complète de services financiers spécialisés et de produits d’investissement.
Avec plus de 1 200 employé.e.s, BNP Paribas au Canada continue d'attirer des experts de différents domaines, ainsi que des jeunes talents ambitieux du monde entier. Nous sommes fiers d'offrir à nos employé.e.s un milieu de travail enrichissant et international où ils peuvent bâtir leur carrière professionnelle en perfectionnant leurs compétences, en relevant des défis et en enrichissant leurs connaissances de l'industrie financière.
Nos certifications et partenariats
Meilleurs Employeurs de Montréal 2022Consultation CCDI, Inc. (Centre Canadien pour la Diversité et l’Inclusion)Certification Arc-en-ciel – Chambre de commerce LGBT+ du Canada (CGLCC)Fierté Canada au travail (Pride at Work Canada)ROSEPH – Regroupement des Organismes Spécialisé pour l’Emploi des Personnes HandicapéesIndigenousWorksLa Gouvernance au Féminin – Certifiée Parité - Certification Argent
Vous voulez découvrir d’autres offres de BNP Paribas au Canada ?
C’est ici : BNP Paribas au Canada | Nos offres d'emploi
 Seules les candidatures qui répondent aux exigences de l'emploi en terme de formation et d'expérience seront évaluées et informées. **

companyDescription:
BNP Paribas is a leading bank in Europe with an international reach. It has a presence in 65 countries, with more than 190,000 employees, including more than 145,000 in Europe. 
BNP Paribas holds leading positions in its three major operating divisions:

⚆ Commercial, Personal Banking & Services for all the Group’s retail banking networks and several specialised businesses, including BNP Paribas Personal Finance and Arval;
⚆ Investment & Protection Services for savings, investment and protection solutions; 
⚆ Corporate & Institutional Banking, which is focused on corporate and institutional clients.

The Group helps all its clients (individuals, community associations, entrepreneurs, SMEs, corporates and institutional clients) to realise their projects through solutions spanning financing, investment, savings and protection insurance. 
In Europe, the Group has four domestic markets (Belgium, France, Italy and Luxembourg) and BNP Paribas Personal Finance is the European leader in consumer lending.
BNP Paribas is rolling out its integrated retail-banking model in Mediterranean countries, in Turkey, in Eastern Europe and a large network in the western part of the United States. In its Corporate & Institutional Banking and Investment & Protection Services activities, BNP Paribas also enjoys top positions in Europe, a strong presence in the Americas as well as a solid and fast-growing business in Asia-Pacific.

To learn more about our social media terms and Data Protection Notice: https://group.bnpparibas/en/data-protection

jobDescription:
The future you want is within reach.

At PCL, we build the places where life happens and find camaraderie in the process. We’re a community of builders committed to building better communities. That’s why we’re always looking ahead, and not just to the next project or what’s next in our industry.

We’re also looking at what’s next for you and how we can help you build a career you’re proud of. As a student at PCL, you will get the opportunity for challenging work assignments in a supportive work environment which promotes personal and professional growth.

We are seeking a Analytics Student for our North American Headquarters (NAHQ) district, within our Canadian Buildings Division that is available for 8 months starting in May 2023. This is an in-person opportunity located in our Edmonton office.

As a Analytics Student, you will have the opportunity to contribute to our team by:

Responsibilities
Developing and maintaining reports and dashboardsTranslating business needs into production reports and dashboardsAcquiring data from a variety of structured and unstructured data sourcesProviding technical support and assistance to report and dashboard consumersCreating and maintaining process and system documentationParticipating in advanced analytics projects Liaising with business, technology, and support teams to ensure business requirements are metIdentifying and suggesting improvements to existing solutions and processesParticipating in quality assurance / system testing

Qualifications
Currently enrolled in a computing science, computer engineering or information management related programKeen interest in data management as it applies to business intelligence and analyticsAbility to quickly gain proficiency in new softwareExperience with data visualization tools such as Power BI is preferred Experience with relational databases and SQL is preferred but not requiredExperience with programming languages such as Python and C# is preferred but not requiredIn addition to the technical skills listed above, the ideal candidate will possess the following qualities:Strong communication skills, both verbal and writtenExcellent problem-solving skillsAbility to work in a fast-paced environment, be flexible, stay organized, and maintain attention to detail and accuracy 

Next Step:
Please note that candidates who have been selected to move forward to the next stage of the recruitment process will receive an email to complete a short online video interview

PCL is an innovative, employee-owned company comprised of people who find passion in their profession and take pride in doing great work every day. Our work powers the infrastructure and utilities that are essential to daily life and our projects are the scene of vacations, careers, education and healing. We are consistently ranked among the best companies to work for because we are committed to supporting and developing our teams.

The PCL Companies celebrate diversity and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating equitable opportunities and an inclusive environment for all employees and applicants. We make employment-related decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability or veteran status.

Should you require an accommodation during the application process, please contact us at careers@pcl.com with the position and location you are interested in.

Together, we can build success and a better future. Let’s get started!

PCL is a group of independent construction companies that carries out work across Canada, the United States, the Caribbean, and in Australia. These diverse operations in the civil infrastructure, heavy industrial, and buildings markets are supported by a strategic presence in 31 major centers.

PCL is 100% employee-owned. Watch us build at www.pcl.com

jobDescription:
Job Type: Full-Time
The Gateway to Your Future
This role provides data and analytical support to corporate and site marketing leaders. They will retrieve data from public sources or internal databases, and manipulate and analyze them to support planning and implementation of company-wide and site-specific initiatives.
Key Responsibilities
Assists the corporate marketing team, develop and execute direct marketing projects / data extraction to achieve the companyâs objectives regarding revenue, profitability, market share, and customer base. Supports business, corporate and property leaders by providing reporting and analysis. Collects, analyzes, and interprets data to provide sound basis for strategic business decisions. Examines marketing promotions and programs to identify opportunities to improve ROI, customer engagement and retention. Analyzes customers behavior and recommends changes to marketing offers, promotions and programs in collaboration with the marketing teamRegularly distill large amounts of data into actionable recommendations and presentations for management. Use exploratory data analysis techniques to identify meaningful relationships, patterns, or trends from complex data setsDrives innovative approaches to marketing analysis and data-driven decision makingPerforms other duties as required. 
What You Bring
3+ years of analytical experience or an equivalent combination of education and experienceUndergraduate degree in either Statistics, Business Analysis, Data Science, Mathematics, Business Administration or an equivalent combination of education and experience.Â Master degree preferred. Highly proficient in statistical language R, with experience in packages including tidyverse, dplyr, ggplot and lubridate. Experience with DBI, rmarkdown, plotly, gt, devtools/usethis etc is optional but preferred. Candidates with python knowledge only will not be considered. Highly proficient in SQL programmingÂ and data warehousing conceptsAdvanced knowledge of Excel, including pivot tables and lookupsStrong analytical and programming skills, including (but not limited to) data manipulation, statistical analytics and marketing studies. Demonstrated proficiency in working with large datasets, and proven track record of producing data-driven insights to support business initiatives. Preference for knowledge of project-oriented workflow in RStudio and modern software collaboration tools (Git and Github)Excellent interpersonal, communication, organizational and multi-tasking skillsWillingness to learn with a superior capacity of understanding new concepts and mastering new skills quickly
We Provide
 Full benefits package for full-time employees Retirement savings plan Exciting, supportive and fun work environment Family and friends discounts on travel, tech, food, beverage, and fitness Development and training opportunities Office environment Manual dexterity required to use desktop computer and peripherals
Why Work for Us?
Gateway celebrates and empowers our team members, who make it all possible. A career at Gateway means working with great people, being recognized for your unique contribution and career advancement opportunities across our 27 locations. Our employees thrive with ongoing training and leadership programs while working in a dynamic and fun environment. See for yourself what it's like to be on a team that values your vision, skill and energy.
Get to Know Gateway
Gateway Casinos & Entertainment Limited (Gateway) is one of the largest and most diversified gaming and entertainment companies in Canada. Across its 27 gaming properties in British Columbia, Ontario and Edmonton, Alberta, Gateway currently employs approximately 8,648 people and boasts approximately 448 table games (including 49 poker tables), 13,887 slots, 85 restaurants and bars and 561 hotel rooms. Gateway is the service provider for the Central, Southwest and North gaming Bundles in Ontario, which includes 11 properties in their portfolio. A multi-pronged growth strategy has seen Gateway diversify and expand its product offering, including developing proprietary casino and restaurant brands, dramatically improving the gaming customer experience while attracting new customers. Some of Gateway's proprietary brands include Match Eatery & Public House, Atlas Steak + Fish and the new Halley's Club. In 2017, Gateway celebrated 25 years in the business of gaming and entertainment in Canada. Further information is available at www.gatewaycasinos.com.
What Is Next
Not the right fit this time? Follow us on our careers social media pages!
Gateway is a proud equal opportunity employer and dedicates itself to Respect, Integrity, Team-Work and Exceptional Customer Service. We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free candidate experience and work environment. If you require accommodation at any point during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know.

Helping develop statistics and reporting of data healthAnalysing data to improve the pricing processes (working closely with the sales team/operators)Process issue root cause analysisSetting up the KPI and audit reporting requirementsGenerating reports from single or multiple systems.Evaluating changes and updates to source production systems.Training end users on new reports and dashboards.Providing technical expertise on data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing. Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college in AccountingMust be proficient in both French and EnglishWork experience as a data analyst or in related field.Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, Client terms.High-level experience in methodologies and processes for managing large scale databases.Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases.High-level written and verbal communication skills.Advanced excel skills (v-look ups & pivot tables,SQL)
If you meet the above qualifications, please submit your resume.

Please note that while we appreciate all applications, only those being considered will be contacted.

jobDescription:
We are hiring freelance English & French speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.

You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
