jobDescription:
OUR BOTTOM LINE IS DIFFERENT.
There's something special about working at ATB, and it's been recognized on every top employer list that matters. Maybe it's our exceptional culture where your total wellness is supported through market-leading benefits and you're free to bring your whole self to work. Maybe it's our commitment to a growth mindset and our unrelenting thirst for making it possible for fellow Albertans—even the ones who aren't our clients.
Whatever it is, you won't find a more genuine, driven and knowledgeable group of humans anywhere. We foster a culture of purpose, performance and possibilities. We engage with intense curiosity, and bring our whole selves to work, every day. We know it starts with people like you, so take a chance and start with us.
Department: ATB Business - Strategy & Performance Enablement
Job Number: REQ5463
Location: Calgary, Alberta
Apply by: January 15, 2023
Paygrade: I-OTH
System Title: Research & Insights Analyst 4
# Positions available: 1
Leader: Cole Schultz
As ATB's next Research & Insights Analyst, you'll be an integral part of ATB Business' Strategy & Performance Enablement team. We're a small but mighty team inside ATB's commercial banking division, providing vital insights to drive business strategy and refine the client experience. You'll work to illuminate market trends that are impacting Alberta businesses, uncover areas of opportunity for ATB to improve our value proposition, and help tell the stories found in internal and external data so that our business partners and senior leaders can make decisions based on the best and most up-to-date knowledge.
Utilize strong research skills to deepen our understanding of provincial, national, and international trends impacting Alberta businesses and ATB.Dive into internal and external datasets to develop a comprehensive understanding of our clients' experience and where it can be improved.Apply modelling and analysis to key economic indicators to provide short and long term forecasts for key sectors.Gather insights and uncover important trends in ESG and the competitive landscape we operate in.Combine quantitative and qualitative analysis and research findings into actionable insights.Translate complex concepts and data-based findings into digestible briefings for diverse audiences via written reports, engaging presentations, and easy to use dashboards.Work closely with team members in analytical and strategy development roles to drive business results.
Requirements
A university degree with a focus in Finance, Accounting, Business, Economics, or EngineeringHave a strong working knowledge of Excel, Google Workspace (formerly GSuite) including Data Studio. Experience using other BI tools such as Tableau or Looker considered an asset.Demonstrated experience working with quantitative and qualitative datasets to derive insights and make recommendations.Strong research abilities; able to quickly locate relevant and reputable sources to determine industry trends and other opportunities/challenges for ATB & our clients.Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including storytelling, and exceptional attention to detail.Come with an analytical mind and be prepared to use evidence and facts to challenge the status quo and prevailing wisdom.Be able to effectively prioritize and manage your time with minimal supervision.Have a strong sense of personal accountability demonstrated by taking pride in your work and ensuring that deliverables are of the highest quality. 
At ATB, we know that as you develop in your career, you gain many transferable skills. If you believe your experience and qualities are what we are looking for, please consider applying!
Interested? If you know one of our team members, BEFORE applying, reach out to them and ask them for a referral link to help your application stand out.
Online applications are preferred. Please let us know if you require any accommodations.
Benefits
BE GREAT. BE YOU. BELIEVE.
We are dedicated to building a workforce reflective of the diversity within our communities and creating an environment where every team member has what they need to reach their potential. We encourage candidates from all equity-seeking groups to apply.
What happens next?
Thank you for applying online. If you are shortlisted for this opportunity, you will hear from us after the posting close date regarding next steps. We might ask you to participate in a digital interview or phone interview. If you require any accommodations, please let us know.
Stay in touch! ATB is excited to know you're interested in a career with us! Follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram to get the inside scoop on what our team is up to.
companyDescription:
For more than 80 years, ATB has been reimagining the way we do business. We’ve grown from one small treasury branch into Alberta’s largest provincially based financial institution, and we don’t have any plans to slow down now. We power possibility for our clients, our team members and our province—and we’re leading the way to a sustainable, innovative and prosperous future.

About ATB Financial

With $59.1 billion in assets, ATB Financial is an Alberta-built financial institution that is a catalyst for economic growth in our province. We got started in 1938 to help Albertans through tough economic times. Today, ATB Financial’s more than 5,000 team members love to deliver exceptional experiences to over 800,000 clients through our many branches and agencies, our 24-hour Client Care Centre, four entrepreneur centres, and our digital banking options. ATB powers possibilities for our clients, Alberta and beyond.

jobDescription:
We are looking for a Consumer Insights Lead who will report to the Global Director of Consumers Insights, Analytics and Performance Management, and who’ll be tasked with providing insights on customer behavior. As part of your role, you’ll be working closely with the performance management, research and data & analytics teams. You will help understand underlying consumer attributes that explain observed behavior. You’ll be at the forefront of a new practice at BRP and will be expected to connect the dots between the work of many specialised teams across the organization (data and analytics, research, business intelligence, etc) to explain consumer behavioral patterns to senior management.

BECOME PART OF OUR TEAM

Here at BRP, we’re creating new ways to get people moving forward, where their experiences are measured by emotion rather than distance. All around the world, our products, achievements and aspirations are a reflection of our teams’ exceptional expertise. Want to bring your true self on this adventure?

You’ll Have The Opportunity To
Collaborate with experts to aggregate all consumer data across Research, Social Listening, CRM, CDP, etc.Interpret available data to form actionable insights (for marketing and business management).Track consumer purchase patterns to predict churn, identify up-sell and cross-sell opportunities and forecast CLV.Contextualize observed behavior vs market / social listening / macro trends.Support Performance Management in explaining campaign / brand performance .
THIS ROLE IS A GOOD FIT IF YOU HAVE THE FOLLOWING SKILLS AND QUALITIES: 
A minimum 5 years of experience across various research and insights roles.Proactive mindset, able to liaise with all relevant internal stakeholders.Naturally curious, self-motivated and passionate about data integrity.Previous experience in visualizing and storytelling data for non-data audiences.Proficiency with consumer intelligence platforms (Qualtrics, Brandwatch, Sprout Social, Mixpanel).Experience with multivariate analysis and other statistical techniques would be preferred.Do you have other qualifications? Tell us what is unique about you that is a great addition to the team.
Does this sound like you? We look forward to receiving your application.

AT BRP, WHEN WE TALK ABOUT BENEFITS, WE GO ALL IN.

Let’s start with a strong foundation — You want it, we have it:
Annual bonus: we work hard, and we know it. This yearly thank you is our way to fuel your dreams.Generous paid time away: winding down is as important as creating the future of recreational products. Pension plan: we want to make sure you’ll enjoy retirement; we’ve got you covered. Collective saving opportunities: being part of BRP allows you to tap into the strength of our saving programs. Industry leading healthcare: fully paid by BRP, this program is here for you, whatever happens, so you can focus on what matters.
What About Some Feel Good Extras
Flexible work schedule: balance is key to innovation, and we want to make sure you are at the top of your game with a schedule that will work for you. Summer schedule: time flies at BRP, so we hit pause to enjoy it.Holiday season shutdown: between Christmas and New Year’s, we close our facilities and refill on good times.Educational resources: you love what you do, and we get you resources to stay cutting-edge, so we all win together.Discount on BRP products: what we build is amazing, freeing, revolutionary, and you're first in line for the experience.
WELCOME TO BRP

We’re a world leader in recreational vehicles and boats, creating innovative ways to move on snow, water, asphalt, dirt and even in the air. Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, our company is rooted in a spirit of ingenuity and intense customer focus. Today, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Australia and Austria, with a workforce made up of close to 20,000 spirited people, all driven by the deeply held belief that at work, as with life itself, it’s not about the destination; It’s about the journey.
companyDescription:
We create innovative ways to move – on snow, on water, on asphalt or dirt – even in the air.

Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, BRP has been reimagining the way you access your world since 2003 and beyond. Building on a tradition of ingenuity and intense customer focus that go all the way back to 1937, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Austria and Australia. We have a total workforce of more than 14,500 driven, resourceful people.

Our portfolio of industry-leading and distinctive products comprises Ski-Doo and Lynx snowmobiles, Sea-Doo watercraft, Can-Am on- and off-road vehicles, Alumacraft, Manitou, Quintrex boats and Rotax marine propulsion systems as well as Rotax engines for karts and recreational aircraft. We support our product lines with a dedicated parts, accessories and clothing business, to fully enhance your riding experience.

Because it’s not about the destination. It’s about the journey. Yours.

Follow us /// Suivez-nous:
Facebook: @brpinfo
Twitter: @BRPnews /// @BRPnouvelles 
YouTube: CommunicationsBRP

jobDescription:
West Fraser is a leading diversified North American forest products company. We are listed on the TSX, NYSE and recognized as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers. Are you interested in working for a company that offers both a challenging work environment and a rewarding career path?
Located in our Toronto, Vancouver, or Memphis office, there is an opening for a:
Market Insights Analyst
Reporting to the Manager of Market Insights the Analyst works in a team environment with the principal objective of synthesizing qualitative and quantitative data into insights on various wood product markets (Lumber, OSB, Plywood etc) to enable strategy development and execution.
Here’s What You’ll Do
Grow the market insights team with a focus to be a subject matter expert on economic data and the translation into demand for various wood products Own and manage the maintenance of existing market models, third party research and related visualization dashboards; drive new model development as we expand our portfolio Designing and conducting primary and secondary research and analysis to aid in achieving sales & marketing strategic objectives Be a key contributor to the development of strategic market and customer insights via commentary, reports and presentations for senior leadership and sales leads Work cross functionally amongst sales, marketing, finance, investor relations, and IT groups in creating solutions for improving processes and data/information flows 
Here’s What You’ll Need
Post-secondary Certificate/Degree in Market Research, Economics, or related field Minimum 2+ years of experience with problem-solving data/trends and summarizing insights that are easily consumable by a wide range of audiences Proven success in conducting qualitative and quantitative research as well as analysis and reporting to internal clients Curiosity and a desire to work smarter, being open to new ways of working and approaching challenges Detail oriented with strong organizational and time management skills Advanced MS Excel and PowerPoint skills Practical experience with MS Power BI a plus Strong acumen in applying research and analysis to address business challenges Strong written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills 
West Fraser is a diversified wood products company producing lumber, OSB, LVL, MDF, plywood, pulp, newsprint, wood chips, and energy with facilities in Canada, the United States, and Europe. We are the largest lumber producer in North America, a leading global manufacturer of wood-based panels and the world’s largest producer of oriented strand board (OSB).
At West Fraser, we believe in giving our employees a challenge they can rise to. We are looking for individuals who are interested in a full-time, long-term career. We offer an excellent compensation package including a competitive salary, excellent benefits and an outstanding pension plan.
We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Please apply through our online application process. To apply, please visit our careers page: https://www.westfraser.com/jobs.
companyDescription: West Fraser is a diversified wood products company with more than 60 facilities in Canada, the United States, the United Kingdom, and Europe. From responsibly sourced and sustainably managed forest resources, the Company produces lumber, engineered wood (OSB, LVL, MDF, plywood, particleboard), and other products including pulp, newsprint, wood chips, and renewable energy. West Fraser’s products are used in home construction, repair and remodelling, industrial applications, papers, tissue and box materials.

jobTitle: STO-RE 21R - Spatial Data Analyst (BC Public Service)
jobDescription:
Posting Title
STO-RE 21R - Spatial Data Analyst
Position Classification
Scientific/Tech Off R21 - Res
Union
GEU
Location
Abbotsford, BC V2S 1H4 CA (Primary)
Salary Range
$63,446.31 - $72,142.65 annually
Close Date
1/15/2023
Job Type
Regular Full Time
Temporary End Date
Ministry/Organization
BC Public Service -> Agriculture and Food
Ministry Branch / Division
Extension and Support Services Branch / Agricultural Resource Division
Job Summary
Make a difference in this rewarding career opportunity
The Extension and Support Services Branch is one of three branches under the Agriculture Resource Division of the BC Ministry of Agriculture and Food. The Branch identifies and promotes agriculture and food production/processing systems that are sustainable and enhance the economic benefits to the province. It maintains operations in all agriculture regions of the province to deliver Ministry programs and services. The Branch works through a variety of strategic partnerships and is the primary point of contact for the Ministry's agriculture clients, including businesses, associations and local governments.
This position is part of the Land Use and Geospatial Unit which includes land use planning, geospatial (GIS) services, traceability programming, livestock premises identification, agricultural land use inventory (ALUI), and emergency response. ALUI provides the current and accurate land cover and land use information that is a prerequisite for responsible and effective management of BC's agricultural land.
The Spatial Data Analyst provides leadership and expertise to the agricultural land use inventory program, including the development of advanced custom tools and processes to efficiently collect, compile, maintain, display, and distribute spatial and attribute inventory data.
The Spatial Data Analyst also works to address critical information needs of the branch and larger ministry by conducting advanced spatial analysis that explore a wide range of current and evolving issues and practices. This position collaborates with a diverse team of GIS experts, agrologists, engineers, and land use planners across several units and branches.
Job Requirements
Bachelor degree or higher in Geomatics and/or GIS, resource management, geography or computer science plus a minimum of two years *related experience; ORA Technical Diploma in Geomatics and/or GIS plus a minimum of three years of *related experience; ORAn equivalent combination of education, training and *related experience may be considered. Related experience must include all of the following:Experience developing and managing large spatial and attribute data sets, and experience with database management standards, tools and applications.Experience developing methodologies and performing custom geo-spatial data modelling and complex geo-spatial analysis.Experience consulting and providing expert geospatial advice to technical and professional staff.Experience within the last two years in data management, spatial analysis, cartography, online applications, and field collection applications using ESRI's software suite.Experience authoring geoprocessing tasks with Python and the ArcPy mapping module. 
Preference May Be Given To Applicants With The Following
Experience preparing and presenting recommendations for land and resource based clients based on analysis or modelling results.Experience with FME, SQL, GitHub, R.Experience with ESRI ArcPro software suite.Experience designing and developing data collections systems using web and mobile technologies.Experience in a natural resource management field (e.g. planning, research, data collection).
Willingness Statements
To have or be able to obtain a Class 5 Driver's License.Willingness to conduct field data collection which may include travel by vehicle with overnight or extended stay in government approved accommodations. 
For questions regarding this position, please contact willow.minaker@gov.bc.ca .
About This Position
This position is located in Abbotsford. Although this position has onsite office requirements, we offer flexible work arrangements, including the opportunity to volunteer to telework part-time (with conditions) as set out in applicable employer policies.
An eligibility list may be established for future temporary or permanent vacancies.
Working For The BC Public Service
The BC Public Service is committed to creating a diverse workplace to represent the population we serve and to better meet the needs of our citizens. Consider joining our team and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.
The Indigenous Applicant Advisory Service can help Indigenous applicants (First Nations [status or non-status],Métis or Inuit) interested in BC Public Service job positions.
The BC Public Service is an award winning employer and offers employees competitive benefits, amazing learning opportunities and a chance to engage in rewarding work with exciting career development opportunities. For more information, please see What We Offer .
How To Apply
Your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the job requirements list above.
Cover letter required: NO - Please do not submit a cover letter as it will not be reviewed.
Resume required: YES - A resume is required as part of your application, however, itmay notbe used for initial shortlisting purposes.
Questionnaire: YES (COMPREHENSIVE) - You will be prompted to complete a comprehensive online questionnaire to demonstrate how you meet the job requirements. Ensure you include all relevant information about your educational accomplishments and employment history including job titles, start and end dates (month and year) of your employment, and how you obtained your relevant experience. Please allot approximately 60 minutes to complete the questionnaire.
Helpful tips, videos and more regarding the application process can be found on the Your Job Application page of MyHR. If you are experiencing technical difficulty applying, e-mail BCPSA.Hiring.Centre@gov.bc.ca , before the stated closing time, and we will respond as soon as possible.
Additional Information
A Criminal Record Check (CRC) will be required.
The BC Public Service COVID-19 Vaccination Policy defines the conditions and expectations for BC Public Service employees regarding vaccination against COVID-19. Among other possible measures, proof of vaccination will be required. It is a term of acceptance of employment that you agree to comply with all vaccination requirements that apply to the public service. More information can be found here .
Applicants selected to move forward in the hiring process may be assessed on the Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies as outlined in the attached Job Profile located at the bottom of the posting.
Applications will be accepted until 11:00 pm Pacific Standard Time on the closing date of the competition.
Job Category
Scientific and Technical
Value

jobTitle: Analyste, conversion de données SAP et gouvernance
jobDescription:
Au CN, nous travaillons ensemble pour faire avancer notre entreprise et l’Amérique du Nord. Intégrez notre équipe Services informatiques et de la technologie (I et T), un élément essentiel du moteur qui nous maintient en mouvement. De l’architecture d’entreprise aux technologies opérationnelles, nos équipes font appel à la méthodologie Agile pour automatiser et numériser notre chemin de fer pour assurer l’optimisation et la sécurité de nos activités et permettre à notre personnel de se consacrer à des tâches à valeur ajoutée. Vous pourrez approfondir vos compétences et bâtir votre carrière dans notre culture tissée serrée et axée sur la sécurité, où nous travaillons ensemble comme UNE ÉQUIPE. Nous offrons des carrières valorisantes car notre travail fait une différence. Embarquez avec nous!

Résumé des fonctions

L’analyste Gouvernance et conversion de données SAP participe à la feuille de route de l’écosystème SAP en planifiant et en exécutant des activités liées aux données et en offrant son expertise à cet effet. Cette personne joue un rôle primordial puisque le CN entreprend actuellement un vaste programme de transformation pluriannuel de ses activités, déclenché par une migration des produits SAP ECC vers SAP S/4 HANA.

La personne titulaire du poste travaille au sein d’une équipe multidisciplinaire et participe à une variété d’activités en lien avec les données : profilage, évaluation de la qualité et nettoyage d’objets de données de base et transactionnelles, dont l’élaboration et la mise en œuvre de stratégies de nettoyage de données; le mappage, la transformation et l’enrichissement de données de base pour prendre en compte les nouveaux modèles de données et les exigences de transformation des produits SAP; et les tâches de gouvernance et de gestion des données selon l’approbation des flux de travail, des configurations et des processus pour assurer la conformité des objets de données aux normes de qualité du CN tout au long de leur cycle de vie.

Cette personne participe aux parcours de validation des données, au dépannage, à la réconciliation des données et à la détermination de mesures correctives avant les migrations vers la version de production.

La personne en poste favorise le développement des compétences et de l’expérience en matière d’établissement et de pratiques de gestion de données de premier ordre, qui deviennent une composante essentielle des secteurs qui adoptent des approches de transformation numérique axées sur les données.

Principales responsabilités

Profilage et nettoyage des données – Tâches liées aux données dans l’environnement actuel – 30 %

Participer à la détermination des objets de données et au profilage des règles commerciales

Évaluer la qualité des données et consigner les indicateurs de mesure de qualité

Participer à la mise en œuvre de stratégies de nettoyage manuel et automatisé des objets de données

Collaborer à la validation itérative post-nettoyage et à la mise en œuvre des mesures correctives

Tirer parti des outils spécialisés et prêts à utiliser pour effectuer des tâches

Mappage et transformation des données – Tâches liées aux données dans l’environnement souhaité – 40 %

Participer à la détermination et à la conception des activités et de la documentation liées au mappage, à la transformation et à l’enrichissement des données fonctionnelles, conformément aux efforts de réingénierie des processus d’affaires et des nouvelles structures de données S/4 HANA

Mettre en œuvre des solutions de type bac à sable pour évaluer les méthodes de transformation et de mappage des données, y compris les algorithmes

Effectuer des parcours de validation itératifs et mettre en place des mesures correctives aux conversions

Tirer parti des outils spécialisés et prêts à utiliser ainsi que des plateformes de conversion pour effectuer des tâches

Gouvernance et gestion des données – Tâches liées aux données associées aux cycles de vie et aux améliorations des données – 30 %

Déterminer, mettre en œuvre et valider les exigences des flux de travail de la gouvernance et des règles des données d’affaires pour la gestion des données de base, en collaboration avec les responsables

Participer à l’évaluation de la qualité des données des systèmes cibles

Appliquer une feuille de route et une stratégie de gouvernance des données sur des outils et des plateformes spécialisés de gestion des données

Participer aux conceptions et à la documentation fonctionnelles, à la configuration de systèmes et à la validation

Schématiser les exigences de gouvernance des données à l’échelle de l’entreprise dans l’environnement SAP

Conditions de travail

Ce poste prévoit des conditions de travail standard dans un bureau et un horaire de travail normal du lundi au vendredi. En raison de la nature du poste, le ou la titulaire doit être en mesure de respecter des échéanciers serrés, de bien tolérer la pression et de gérer le stress.

Exigences

Expérience

Gestion et traitement des données d’entreprise

De 1 à 3 ans d’expérience en gestion et en traitement des données d’entreprise

Formation, certification et désignation

Baccalauréat dans un domaine technique ou commercial avec un intérêt pour la gestion des données

Baccalauréat en analyse commerciale, en mathématiques, en statistiques, en science des données ou en génie*
 Toute désignation dans l’un des domaines ci-dessus constitue un atout
Compétences

Inspirer les autres par des communications efficaces et s’adapter à l’auditoire à l’oral et à l’écrit

Utiliser le raisonnement analytique

Faire preuve d’innovation par la résolution de problèmes

Connaître l’entreprise et être à l’affût des tendances du secteur pour développer son expertise et mieux accomplir son travail

Faire preuve d’un bon sens de l’organisation

Collaborer avec les principaux intervenants internes pour fournir un meilleur rendement

Être en mesure de travailler de manière autonome sans supervision

Connaissances et compétences techniques

Vif intérêt pour la gestion et la validation des données, notamment ses attributs et caractéristiques ainsi que sa valeur pour l’entreprise

Expérience pratique en planification et en exécution générale de tâches d’extraction, de transformation et de chargement (ETL) de données*

Expérience avec des systèmes de planification des ressources d’entreprise (PRE), en particulier SAP (SAP ECC, SAP S/4 HANA)*

Intérêt pour les processus d’affaires et la façon dont les données sont interreliées avec ces processus

Intérêt pour l’exploration des données, la réalisation d’enquêtes et d’analyses et l’application de la résolution et de la validation dans des ensembles de données complexes

Connaissance d’Excel ou d’autres outils de productivité

Capacité et intérêt dans le développement de connaissances avancées d’utilisation de plateformes et d’outils de gestion des données spécialisés comme Syniti Advanced Data Migration (ADM), SAP Master Data Governance (MDG), SAP Utopia et SAP Asset Information Workbench (AIW)

Capacité de présenter et de communiquer clairement les résultats

Connaissance du langage SQL (Structured Query Language) et des scripts, notamment SQL Server Management Studio*
 Toute connaissance dans l’un des domaines ci-dessus constitue un atout
Incidence sur l’entreprise

Prise de décisions et incidence des décisions

La personne titulaire du poste effectue des tâches axées sur les données qui sont essentielles à la feuille de route et au cycle de vie de l’écosystème SAP.

Degré d’interaction ou d’influence

L’analyste Gouvernance et conversion de données SAP interagit avec les experts en données des clients internes et de l’I et T, des coordonnateurs, des spécialistes de la technologie des données, des architectes de solutions et des équipes de gouvernance des données à l’échelle de l’entreprise. En outre, cette personne collabore étroitement avec leurs homologues commerciaux et fonctionnels des Finances, de l’Approvisionnement, de la Gestion de l’approvisionnement, de la Mécanique et de l’Ingénierie.

Supervision du personnel/structure organisationnelle

L’analyste Gouvernance et conversion de données SAP relève du directeur principal ou de la directrice principale Transformation SAP S/4HANA, Gouvernance et migration des données – Information et technologie. Ce poste ne comporte aucune responsabilité de supervision.

À propos du CN

Le CN est un chef de file mondial du transport et un partenaire commercial majeur. Essentiel pour l'économie, les clients et les communautés dans lesquelles il exerce ses activités, le CN transporte annuellement de façon sécuritaire plus de 300 millions de tonnes de ressources naturelles, de produits manufacturés et de produits finis partout en Amérique du Nord. Seul chemin de fer reliant les côtes est et ouest du Canada à la pointe sud des États-Unis avec un réseau ferroviaire de 19 500 milles, le CN et ses filiales contribuent à la prospérité des collectivités et au commerce durable depuis 1919. Le CN demeure engagé à soutenir des programmes supportant la responsabilité sociale et les initiatives de protection de l’environnement. Au CN, nous travaillons comme UNE ÉQUIPE axée sur la sécurité et nos clients, offrant l’excellence sur le plan de l’exploitation et de la chaîne d’approvisionnement pour produire des résultats.

Le CN exige que tous les membres de son personnel au Canada soient entièrement vaccinés contre le COVID-19 et qu'ils en fournissent la preuve comme condition d'emploi. Le mandat de vaccination de la Compagnie s'étend aux membres du personnel de ses filiales en propriété exclusive ainsi qu'aux entrepreneurs, consultants, agents et fournisseurs du CN et à toute personne ayant accès aux propriétés du CN au Canada.

Le CN exige que tous les membres de son personnel soient entièrement vaccinés contre le COVID-19 et qu'ils en fournissent la preuve comme condition d'emploi. Le mandat de vaccination de la Compagnie s'étend aux membres du personnel de ses filiales en propriété exclusive ainsi qu'aux entrepreneurs, consultants, agents et fournisseurs du CN et à toute personne ayant accès aux propriétés du CN au Canada.

La forme grammaticale utilisée dans ce document vaut tant pour les hommes que pour les femmes. Le CN souscrit au principe de l’équité en emploi et invite toutes les personnes qualifiées à présenter leur candidature. Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt; cependant, nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les personnes dont la candidature sera retenue. Veuillez consulter régulièrement vos courriels, car les communications sont surtout envoyées par courrier électronique.
companyDescription:
CN is a North American transportation and logistics leader focused on supply chain innovation and collaboration. We offer integrated shipping solutions, including rail, intermodal, trucking, freight forwarding, warehousing and distribution. 

We are an engaged corporate citizen, committed to the safety of our employees, customers and the public. CN is invested in building shareholder value and stronger communities, focused on environmental stewardship and developing an exceptional environment in the workplace.
 
CN has the expertise, the network reach and the capacity to move your goods to a global marketplace in a safe, timely and cost effective manner. 

Welcome to CN, North America's Railroad.

jobTitle: Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance
jobDescription:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!
Job Summary
The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance contributes to the SAP ecosystem roadmap by planning, executing and providing expertise on data-related activities.The role is instrumental as CN is currently undertaking a large multi-year business transformation program triggered by a SAP ECC to a SAP S/4 HANA product migration.
The incumbent works within a multi-disciplinary team and participates in a variety of data activities, namely: profiling, quality assessment and cleansing of master and transactional data objects, including establishment of data cleansing strategies and their implementation;master data mapping, transformation and enrichment, to account for new SAP product data models and business transformationrequirements; and data governance and management tasks on approval workflows, configurations and processes to ensure data objects maintain compliance to CN quality standards throughout their lifecycle.
The incumbent contributes to data validation runs, troubleshooting, data reconciliation and identification of corrective actions prior to production migrations.
The position helps develop skills and experience in setting up and managing best-in-class data pipelines that are becoming essential building block in industries adopting data-centric digital transformation approaches.
Main Responsibilities
 Data Profiling and Cleansing – Data-Related Tasks on the “As-Is” Environment – 30% 
Participates in data objects identification and businessrules profiling
Performs dataqualityassessment and qualitymetrics reporting
Participates in manual/automated data object cleansing strategies and their implementation
Collaborates to the iterative post-cleansing validation and implementation of corrective measures
Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools to carry out tasks
 Data Mapping and Transformation - Data-Related Tasks on the “To-Be” Environment – 40% 
Participates in identification and design of functional data mapping, transformation and enrichment activities and documentation according to the business process re-engineering efforts and new S/4 HANA data structures
Implements sandbox solutions to assess data mapping and transformation methods, including algorithms
Performs iterative validation runs and implement corrective measures on conversions
Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools and conversion platforms to carry out tasks
Data Governance and Management - Data-Related Tasks on the Data Lifecycle and Enhancements – 30%
Identifies, implements, and validates governance workflow and data business rules requirements for master data management, in conjunction with business owners
Takes part in data quality assessment on target systems
Implements data governance roadmap and strategy on specialized data management tools and platforms
Participates in functional designs and documentation, system configuration, and validation
Maps enterprise-level data governance requirements into SAP landscape
 Working Conditions 
The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday. Due to the nature of the role, the incumbent must be able to meet tight deadlines, handle pressure, and stress.
Requirements
 Experience 
Managing and Handling Enterprise Data
Between 1 to 3 years of experience in managing and handling enterprise data
 Education/Certification/Designation 
Bachelor’s Degree in a technical or business field, with an interest in data management
Bachelor’s Degree in Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science orEngineering*
Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset
Competencies
Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing
Applies analytical thinking
Innovates through problem solving
Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work
Demonstrates organizational abilities
Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity
Works independently with little supervision
Technical Skills/Knowledge
Strong interest in managing and validating data, understanding its attributes, characteristics and business value.
Hands-on experience in planning and executing general Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) data tasks*
Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems, in particular SAP (SAP ECC, SAP S/4 HANA)*
Strong interest in business processes and the way data interrelates to those processes
Interest in exploring data, performing investigation and analysis, and applying resolution and validation in complex data sets
Knowledge of Excel or equivalent productivity tools
Ability and interest in developing advanced user knowledge of specialized data management platforms and tools such as Syniti Advanced Data Migration (ADM), SAP Master Data Governance (MDG), SAP Utopia, SAP Asset Information Workbench (AIW)
Ability to present and communicate results clearly
Knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL) statements and scripting, including SQL Server Management Studio*
Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset
 Organizational Impact 
 Decision Making & Impacts 
The position performs data-centric tasks that are foundational to the SAP ecosystem roadmap and lifecycle
 Level of Interaction/Influence 
The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance interacts with business and Information and Technology (I&T) data experts, Coordinators, Data Technology Specialists, Solution Architects, enterprise-level data governance teams, as well as working closely with their business and functional counterparts in Finance, Procurement, Supply Management, Mechanical and Engineering organizations.
 Employees Supervised/Organizational Structure 
The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance reports to the Senior Manager, SAP S/4 HANA Transformation, Data Governance and Migration, Information and Technology. The role has no supervisory responsibilities.
CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.
CN requires that all employees in Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. The Company’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly owned subsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers and anyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.
 For internal candidates, note that the grade level of the position will depend on the employee's experience. 
CN requires that all employees be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. The Company’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly owned subsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers and anyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.
CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

jobDescription:
Au CN, nous travaillons ensemble pour faire avancer notre entreprise et l’Amérique du Nord. Intégrez notre équipe Services informatiques et de la technologie (I et T), un élément essentiel du moteur qui nous maintient en mouvement. De l’architecture d’entreprise aux technologies opérationnelles, nos équipes font appel à la méthodologie Agile pour automatiser et numériser notre chemin de fer pour assurer l’optimisation et la sécurité de nos activités et permettre à notre personnel de se consacrer à des tâches à valeur ajoutée. Vous pourrez approfondir vos compétences et bâtir votre carrière dans notre culture tissée serrée et axée sur la sécurité, où nous travaillons ensemble comme UNE ÉQUIPE. Nous offrons des carrières valorisantes car notre travail fait une différence. Embarquez avec nous!

 Résumé des fonctions 

L’analyste Exploitation des données doit analyser et gérer avec succès les données générées par les technologies, les services et les systèmes du CN ou de l’extérieur.

En plus de contribuer à l’évolution globale de l’I et T du CN, cette personne veille à ce que les membres de l’équipe et les projets respectent toutes les exigences opérationnelles.

Les clients peuvent provenir de l’équipe I et T du CN ou des divers secteurs d’activité.

L’analyste Exploitation des données travaille en collaboration avec les équipes de scientifique des données, d’opérations d’apprentissage automatique et de processus de développement et d’exploitation (DevOps) pour concevoir et améliorer des solutions de données automatisées à temps plein entre les systèmes dans le nuage.

Cette personne élabore également des codes de vérification, et conçoit et optimise les outils de surveillance. Cette personne fait partie de l’équipe Exploitation des données et dirige des analyses après action pour le soutien à l’exploitation.

 Principales responsabilités 
 Concevoir et optimiser les pipelines de données pour faciliter l’extraction de données de sources multiples et les charger dans des entrepôts de données Utiliser l’automatisation pour simplifier le traitement des données Concevoir, mettre en place et maintenir des bases de données, des systèmes de collecte de données, des analyses de données et d’autres stratégies afin d’optimiser l’efficacité et la qualité statistiques Savoir repérer, analyser et interpréter des schémas, des tendances ou des modèles dans des données complexes Tester et adopter des solutions et des outils qui respectent les pratiques exemplaires d’Exploitation des données Améliorer les processus de développement et de déploiement des données Mettre en œuvre des normes de sécurité des données qui doivent être appliquées à l’ensemble des pipelines de données
Conditions de travail

 Ce poste prévoit des conditions de travail standard dans un bureau et un horaire de travail normal du lundi au vendredi. 

 Exigences minimales 
 Au moins 3 ans d’expérience de travail pertinente (avec une attention particulière en exploitation des données et en analyse des données)  Maîtrise ou baccalauréat en informatique, en génie informatique ou l’équivalent  Excellente connaissance de l’informatique infonuagique (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud, DataBricks)  Excellente connaissance des bases de données (MySQL, NoSQL, etc.)  Excellente connaissance du codage dans Python, Java  Expérience de travail avec des données structurées et non structurées  Connaissance de l’assurance de la qualité  Connaissance de REST API et de Node API  Connaissance des outils d’intégration continue et de livraison continue (Jenkins, Azure DevOps, Github, etc.)  Connaissance en gestion des registres, en surveillance d’applications et en surveillance d’infrastructures  Expérience de Kubernetes, Kafka et MQ  Expérience d’un outil d’orchestration des données (ADF, Databricks Workflows, etc.) 
 ATOUTS 
 Expérience d’Azure Data Explorer (ADX)  Solides compétences en communication  Capacité à sortir des sentiers battus  Certification DevOps  Expérience du secteur ferroviaire et de la commande intégrale des trains (CIT)  Expérience de l’Internet des objets  Expérience des projets d’apprentissage machine (MLOps)  Connaissance des réseaux, de la sécurité et des protocoles  Certification d’analyse des données (Azure, Databricks, GCP ou autre plateforme)  Certification d’expert en ingénierie des données (Azure DP-203, Databricks, GCP ou autre plateforme) 
 À propos du CN 

Le CN est un chef de file mondial du transport et un partenaire commercial majeur. Essentiel pour l'économie, les clients et les communautés dans lesquelles il exerce ses activités, le CN transporte annuellement de façon sécuritaire plus de 300 millions de tonnes de ressources naturelles, de produits manufacturés et de produits finis partout en Amérique du Nord. Seul chemin de fer reliant les côtes est et ouest du Canada à la pointe sud des États-Unis avec un réseau ferroviaire de 19 500 milles, le CN et ses filiales contribuent à la prospérité des collectivités et au commerce durable depuis 1919. Le CN demeure engagé à soutenir des programmes supportant la responsabilité sociale et les initiatives de protection de l’environnement. Au CN, nous travaillons comme UNE ÉQUIPE axée sur la sécurité et nos clients, offrant l’excellence sur le plan de l’exploitation et de la chaîne d’approvisionnement pour produire des résultats.

Le CN exige que tous les membres de son personnel soient entièrement vaccinés contre le COVID-19 et qu'ils en fournissent la preuve comme condition d'emploi. Le mandat de vaccination de la Compagnie s'étend aux membres du personnel de ses filiales en propriété exclusive ainsi qu'aux entrepreneurs, consultants, agents et fournisseurs du CN et à toute personne ayant accès aux propriétés du CN au Canada.

La forme grammaticale utilisée dans ce document vaut tant pour les hommes que pour les femmes. Le CN souscrit au principe de l’équité en emploi et invite toutes les personnes qualifiées à présenter leur candidature. Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt; cependant, nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les personnes dont la candidature sera retenue. Veuillez consulter régulièrement vos courriels, car les communications sont surtout envoyées par courrier électronique.

jobDescription:
TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects.
We offer  flexible work-from-home  opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are  part-time  , and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com
We are hiring freelance English and French speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.
This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.
Requirements
 Full Professional Proficiency in English and French  You must be living in Canada the last consecutive years  Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information  You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Canada  Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)  Applicants must be 18 years or over. 
Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.
Why Join the TELUS International AI Community? 
 Earn extra income  Access to our community wellbeing initiative  Remote work & Location Independence  Be your own boss  Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle  Be a part of an online community 
Additional Job Description
 We are hiring freelance English & French speaking Online Data Analyst’s for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.
companyDescription: TELUS International designs, builds and delivers next-generation digital solutions to enhance the customer experience (CX) for global and disruptive brands. The company’s services support the full lifecycle of its clients’ digital transformation journeys and enable them to more quickly embrace next-generation digital technologies to deliver better business outcomes. TELUS International’s integrated solutions and capabilities span digital strategy, innovation, consulting and design, digital transformation and IT lifecycle solutions, data annotation and intelligent automation, and omnichannel CX solutions that include content moderation, trust and safety solutions, and other managed solutions. Fueling all stages of company growth, TELUS International partners with brands across high growth industry verticals, including tech and games, communications and media, eCommerce and fintech, healthcare, and travel and hospitality.

jobTitle: Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance
jobDescription:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!
Job Summary
The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance contributes to the SAP ecosystem roadmap by planning, executing and providing expertise on data-related activities.The role is instrumental as CN is currently undertaking a large multi-year business transformation program triggered by a SAP ECC to a SAP S/4 HANA product migration.
The incumbent works within a multi-disciplinary team and participates in a variety of data activities, namely: profiling, quality assessment and cleansing of master and transactional data objects, including establishment of data cleansing strategies and their implementation;master data mapping, transformation and enrichment, to account for new SAP product data models and business transformationrequirements; and data governance and management tasks on approval workflows, configurations and processes to ensure data objects maintain compliance to CN quality standards throughout their lifecycle.
The incumbent contributes to data validation runs, troubleshooting, data reconciliation and identification of corrective actions prior to production migrations.
The position helps develop skills and experience in setting up and managing best-in-class data pipelines that are becoming essential building block in industries adopting data-centric digital transformation approaches.
Main Responsibilities
 Data Profiling and Cleansing – Data-Related Tasks on the “As-Is” Environment – 30% 
Participates in data objects identification and businessrules profiling
Performs dataqualityassessment and qualitymetrics reporting
Participates in manual/automated data object cleansing strategies and their implementation
Collaborates to the iterative post-cleansing validation and implementation of corrective measures
Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools to carry out tasks
 Data Mapping and Transformation - Data-Related Tasks on the “To-Be” Environment – 40% 
Participates in identification and design of functional data mapping, transformation and enrichment activities and documentation according to the business process re-engineering efforts and new S/4 HANA data structures
Implements sandbox solutions to assess data mapping and transformation methods, including algorithms
Performs iterative validation runs and implement corrective measures on conversions
Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools and conversion platforms to carry out tasks
Data Governance and Management - Data-Related Tasks on the Data Lifecycle and Enhancements – 30%
Identifies, implements, and validates governance workflow and data business rules requirements for master data management, in conjunction with business owners
Takes part in data quality assessment on target systems
Implements data governance roadmap and strategy on specialized data management tools and platforms
Participates in functional designs and documentation, system configuration, and validation
Maps enterprise-level data governance requirements into SAP landscape
 Working Conditions 
The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday. Due to the nature of the role, the incumbent must be able to meet tight deadlines, handle pressure, and stress.
Requirements
 Experience 
Managing and Handling Enterprise Data
Between 1 to 3 years of experience in managing and handling enterprise data
 Education/Certification/Designation 
Bachelor’s Degree in a technical or business field, with an interest in data management
Bachelor’s Degree in Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science orEngineering*
Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset
Competencies
Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing
Applies analytical thinking
Innovates through problem solving
Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work
Demonstrates organizational abilities
Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity
Works independently with little supervision
Technical Skills/Knowledge
Strong interest in managing and validating data, understanding its attributes, characteristics and business value.
Hands-on experience in planning and executing general Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) data tasks*
Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems, in particular SAP (SAP ECC, SAP S/4 HANA)*
Strong interest in business processes and the way data interrelates to those processes
Interest in exploring data, performing investigation and analysis, and applying resolution and validation in complex data sets
Knowledge of Excel or equivalent productivity tools
Ability and interest in developing advanced user knowledge of specialized data management platforms and tools such as Syniti Advanced Data Migration (ADM), SAP Master Data Governance (MDG), SAP Utopia, SAP Asset Information Workbench (AIW)
Ability to present and communicate results clearly
Knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL) statements and scripting, including SQL Server Management Studio*
Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset
 Organizational Impact 
 Decision Making & Impacts 
The position performs data-centric tasks that are foundational to the SAP ecosystem roadmap and lifecycle
 Level of Interaction/Influence 
The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance interacts with business and Information and Technology (I&T) data experts, Coordinators, Data Technology Specialists, Solution Architects, enterprise-level data governance teams, as well as working closely with their business and functional counterparts in Finance, Procurement, Supply Management, Mechanical and Engineering organizations.
 Employees Supervised/Organizational Structure 
The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance reports to the Senior Manager, SAP S/4 HANA Transformation, Data Governance and Migration, Information and Technology. The role has no supervisory responsibilities.
CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.
CN requires that all employees in Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. The Company’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly owned subsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers and anyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.
 For internal candidates, note that the grade level of the position will depend on the employee's experience. 
CN requires that all employees be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. The Company’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly owned subsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers and anyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.
CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.
companyDescription:
CN is a North American transportation and logistics leader focused on supply chain innovation and collaboration. We offer integrated shipping solutions, including rail, intermodal, trucking, freight forwarding, warehousing and distribution. 

We are an engaged corporate citizen, committed to the safety of our employees, customers and the public. CN is invested in building shareholder value and stronger communities, focused on environmental stewardship and developing an exceptional environment in the workplace.
 
CN has the expertise, the network reach and the capacity to move your goods to a global marketplace in a safe, timely and cost effective manner. 

Welcome to CN, North America's Railroad.

jobTitle: Freelance - French speaking Online Data Analyst
jobDescription:
TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com
We are hiring freelance (English & French speaking) Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.
This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.
RequirementsFull Professional Proficiency in English & FrenchYou must be living in Canada the last 2 consecutive yearsAbility to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website informationYou must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in CanadaBeing open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)Applicants must be 18 years or over.Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.
Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?Earn extra incomeAccess to our community wellbeing initiativeRemote work & Location IndependenceBe your own bossFlexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyleBe a part of an online community
What’s next?If this sounds like a role you’d be interested in taking on, please apply below.https://jobs.telusinternational.com/en_US/careers/PipelineDetail/Online-Data-Analyst-Canada-French-Language/21410
"All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status."

jobDescription:
Description:* Provides excellent customer support by analyzing, processing and responding to external customer and internal teams inquires. Processes orders and inquiries as needed, including those received via phone, fax and email. Processes returns & answer inbound/outbound phone calls. This person will start by doing more data entry tasks, and will eventually start taking calls (40-80 calls/day per person). Client interactions will be regarding late orders, follow-ups on order status, lost shipment, incorrect order, etc.Additional Skills & Qualifications:* MUST HAVES2+ years of experience in customer service.Post secondary education (DEC, University, etc.).Excellent communication skills (Orals and Written) in both English and French.Experience in data entry.Basic knowledge of MS Office.

NICE TO HAVES
Contact center experience/call center.Pharmaceutical industry knowledge.SAP experience. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Description:* Fournit un excellent support client en analysant, traitant et répondant aux demandes des clients externes et des équipes internes. Traite les commandes et les demandes de renseignements au besoin, y compris celles reçues par téléphone, télécopieur et courriel. Traite les retours et répond aux appels téléphoniques entrants/sortants. Cette personne commencera par faire plus de tâches de saisie de données et finira par prendre des appels (40-80 appels/jour par personne). Les interactions avec les clients concernent les commandes en retard, les suivis de l'état des commandes, les envois perdus, les commandes incorrectes, etc.INCONTOURNABLES*2+ années d'expérience en service à la clientèle. - Études postsecondaires (DEC, Université, etc.)Excellentes compétences en communication (orale et écrite) en anglais et en français.Expérience en saisie de données.Connaissance de base de MS Office.BON À AVOIR*Expérience en centre de contact/centre d'appels.Expérience dans l'industrie pharmaceutique (connaissance de l'industrie).Expérience SAP.

Aston Carter, une division d'Aerotek, est un fournisseur d'envergure mondiale de services de recrutement et de dotation de personnel pour les sociétés à la recherche de professionnels du milieu des affaires hautement spécialisés. Aerotek est une société en exploitation d'Allegis Group, un fournisseur multinational de solutions en matière de talent. Avec plus de 60 bureaux en Europe, Asie et Amérique du Nord, Aston Carter offre une expertise locale, régionale et mondiale pour répondre aux besoins uniques de ses clients. Spanning four continents and more than 200 offices, we extend our clients’ capabilities by seeking solvers and delivering solutions to address today’s workforce challenges. 

Specializing in accounting and finance; governance, risk and compliance; customer support; and operations and administrative roles, we're here to connect organizations and professionals to drive innovative solutions shaped by critical-thinking professionals. To learn more, visit AstonCarter.com. Aston Carter is a company within Allegis Group, a global leader in talent solutions.

jobDescription:
SAS Analytics Analyst* Our client is seeking a SAS Analytics Analyst for a 6-month contract with potential for extension, and possibility of conversion into a permanent role. This role is open because our contractor is being converted into a permanent position. The Analytics team is looking for an Analytics Analyst who is strong in SAS data/programming (SQL too), strong in Excel, and someone who can effectively communicate with the government body (this project is government-based and falls within their Business Banking portfolio). MUST HAVES: SAS data/programming 2) Excel 3) Strong communication NICE TO HAVES: Data Visualization (Power BI, etc.) Banking or Financial Services 3) Mathematics Education (not required, but an asset)
